course.title: Inside Government: Making Public Policy
course.faculty_text: Cass Robert Sunstein (Law School) and Lawrence H. Summers
course.description: This seminar will explore an assortment of issues, ranging from environmental regulation (including climate change) to financial regulation to public health, at the intersection of theory and practice. Among other things, the seminar will discuss the role of cost-benefit analysis, legal limits on regulation, and both standard and behavioral economics.
course.notes: Jointly offered with the Kennedy School as BGP-300 and the Law School as 2623.
